snippet: The attack, which left 16 Egyptian soldiers dead, brought several early signs of cooperation and coordination between the governments.
abstract: Attack by masked gunman on Egyptian soldiers in Sinai Peninsula presents both a crucial opportunity and test of relationship between Egypt and Israel; high-ranking officials inside Israel’s government and experts on Israel-Egypt relations say attack, which left 16 soldiers dead, is best evidence yet that the two countries are both threatened by lawlessness in the Sinai Peninsula.

byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Cairo, and Fares Akram from Gaza City.

lead_paragraph: The attack, which left 16 Egyptian soldiers dead, brought several early signs of cooperation and coordination between the governments.

headline.seo: Sinai Attack a Test for Israel, Egypt and Gaza
headline.main: Sinai Attack Tests New Egyptian President’s Relationship With Israel
headline.print_headline: Sinai Attack Tests New Egyptian President’s Relationship With Israel

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
